Articles.Content: I was watching the new video for ksp 2.0 when I noticed something at the flag part. after the kerbal opened the flag, it flapped like it was in the wind. just like that whole thing about the Apollo landing being fake because of the flag looked like it was moving in the wind.

No, the flags all do that.

Besides, it's because of momentum that that happens.
Nope, they move because there's no air to stop them, so they move much longer than they would do here on Earth.
Also, since when was there a version 2 of ksp?

Also, since when was there a version 2 of ksp?

aahw man! I just lost 19 KSP
There is a conspiracy theory that says that KSP's 0.2 update Recovered Munar Footage is in fact staged and never happened

Also, since when was there a version 2 of ksp?

Since about the same time they rolled back 17 versions to the .2 release.

people do not understand physics, flag is a fabric AKA Not ridged, what do you think is gona happen when you move the flag pole around, it does not need air, it will continue to move for some time after being planted because the only thing it is losing its momentum through is the pole.

There is a conspiracy theory that says that KSP's 0.2 update Recovered Munar Footage is in fact staged and never happened

Well, you see there is no explosions when lifting off the munar surface. It's not plausible that is happened.

No, the flags all do that.

Besides, it's because of momentum that that happens.

It is also made with a springy fabric!
Well, the real reason that the flag moves is because of a stray wind--KSC actually filmed that video on Duna, the entire Mun landing was fake I'm afraid....
Two reasons why the movement doesn't dampen out fast on the Mun (or the Moon for that matter). One, no air pressure for the material to press against and Two, the low gravity.
